Sure! Verizon took several measures to ensure the safety of its employees during the pandemic, including:

1. Remote Work: Verizon quickly transitioned to remote work arrangements for non-essential personnel to reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission. They provided their employees with the necessary equipment and tools to work from home, including laptops, mobile phones, and video conference capabilities.

2. Temperature Checks and Daily Health Screenings: All Verizon employees who reported to a Verizon facility were required to undergo temperature checks and daily health screenings to monitor for COVID-19 symptoms.

3. Social Distancing: Verizon implemented social distancing protocols in its facilities where social distancing was enforced through floor markers, capacity limitations, and rearrangement of furniture.

4. Personal Protective Equipment: Verizon provided personal protective equipment, such as masks and gloves, to its employees who reported to facilities where social distancing was challenging.

5. Enhanced Cleaning and Sanitization: Verizon increased the frequency and intensity of cleaning and sanitization of its facilities to help minimize the risk of COVID-19 transmission.

6. Employee Communication: Verizon maintains open communication channels with its employees to provide regular updates on company policies, protocols, and safety guidelines to help prevent COVID-19 transmission.

Overall, these measures by Verizon aimed at ensuring the safety and well-being of its employees during the pandemic. By taking these measures, Verizon was able to continue delivering essential services to its customers while prioritizing the safety of its employees.
